item.title: Method and system for information retrieval
item.description: Abstract A perspective-based search system and method is disclosed. The perspective based system allows users to select specific perspectives on a search topic and view the results from those perspectives.

item.title: Trustworthy ML & Robust Statistics
item.description: As machine learning systems are pervasively deployed in many scientific fields with increasingly sensitive tasks, it has become paramount to develop algorithms that are robust against the numerous sources of uncertainty inherent in those applications including noise in the data, malicious exploitation of vulnerabilities, outliers, variability of the true objective, privacy, and fairness.

item.title: An expectation-maximization algorithm for query translation based on pseudo-relevant documents
item.description: Abstract Query translation in cross-language information retrieval (CLIR) can be done by employing dictionaries, aligned corpora, or machine translators.

item.title: Building a multi-domain comparable corpus using a learning to rank method
item.description: Abstract Comparable corpora are key translation resources for both languages and domains with limited linguistic resources.

item.title: Data-driven mapping between functional connectomes using optimal transport
item.description: Abstract Functional connectomes derived from functional magnetic resonance imaging have long been used to understand the functional organization of the brain.

item.title: A mass multivariate edge-wise approach for combining multiple connectomes to improve the detection of group differences | Best Poster in Connectomics in NeuroImage
item.description: Abstract Functional connectivity derived from functional magnetic resonance imaging data has been extensively used to characterize individual and group differences.

item.title: Dimension projection among languages based on pseudo-relevant documents for query translation
item.description: Abstract Using top-ranked documents in response to a query has been shown to be an effective approach to improve the quality of query translation in dictionary- based cross-language information retrieval.

item.title: Learning to Weight Translations using Ordinal Linear Regression and Query-generated Training Data for Ad-hoc Retrieval with Long Queries
item.description: Abstract Ordinal regression which is known with learning to rank has long been used in information re- trieval (IR).

item.title: Pseudo-relevance feedback based on matrix factorization
item.description: Abstract In information retrieval, pseudo-relevance feedback (PRF) refers to a strategy for updating the query model using the top retrieved documents.

item.title: SS4MCT: a statistical stemmer for morphologically complex texts
item.description: Abstract There have been multiple attempts to resolve various inflec- tion matching problems in information retrieval.

item.title: Optimal Transport and Brain Imaging
item.description: Fuctional connectomes, derived from functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) is widely used to study functional organization of human brain.

item.title: Variational AutoEncoders and Topic Modeling
item.description: Topic modeling is a powerful technique to assign appropriate distributions to words and documents.

item.title: A hitchhiker’s guide to working with large, open-source neuroimaging datasets
item.description: Abstract Large datasets that enable researchers to perform investigations with unprecedented rigor are growing increasingly common in neuroimaging.

item.title: Functional Connectivity During Frustration: Predictive Modeling of Irritability in Youth
item.description: Abstract Irritability cuts across many pediatric disorders and is a common presenting complaint in child psychiatry; however, its neural mechanisms remain unclear.

item.title: Transdiagnostic, Connectome-Based Prediction of Memory Constructs Across Psychiatric Disorders
item.description: Abstract Memory deficits are observed in a range of psychiatric disorders, but it is unclear whether memory deficits arise from a shared brain correlate across disorders or from various dysfunctions unique to each disorder.

item.title: Predicting BMI From Whole-Brain Functional Connectivity
item.description: Abstract Variations in body habitus (eg obesity) have been linked to widespread changes in the brain.

item.title: Computational Neuroscience
item.description: The human brain is a complex network, consisting of functionally interconnected regions whose coordinated effort gives rise to different functions.

item.title: Non-convex Optimization
item.description: Until recently, convex programs were seen as the defining boundary for tractability in continuous optimization.

item.title: Sequence to Logic with Copy and Cache
item.description: Abstract Generating logical form equivalents of human language is a fresh way to employ neural architectures where long short-term memory effectively captures dependencies in both encoder and decoder units.

item.title: Zero-shot transfer learning for semantic parsing
item.description: Abstract While neural networks have shown impressive performance on large datasets, applying these models to tasks where little data is available remains a challenging problem.

item.title: Online Learning
item.description: In many practical applications, the environment is so complex that it may be infeasible to lay out a precise model and use the classical mathematical optimization methods.

item.title: Submodular Optimization
item.description: The difficulty of searching through a massive amount of data in order to quickly make an informed decision is one of today’s most ubiquitous challenges.

item.title: Interactive Decision Making
item.description: In computer science, and machine learning in particular, the primary purpose of many systems is to help humans make decisions.

item.title: Biography
item.description: I’m Javid Dadashkarimi PhD candidate in computer science department at Yale University.
